pages.text: $(o)Extract from the writings of the Archdruid of the Silvered Glade, 0 AC:$()$(br2)... these large gateways previously used have been closed completely. Whether this is a result of the continued drifting of the realms or a distinct shutting down of diplomacy, the result is that trade with the Fey directly is no longer possible.

The fey, well-known for curiosity, are ever interested in strange new worlds, such as our own. The most curious are also the smallest, and these motes of life & energy have found their way through the tiniest gaps and spaces. This proves that there are ways and potentially no major barriers.$(br2)Whether this can be leveraged or not remains...

$(o)Extract from the notes of the Master of Crafting, 241 AC:$()$(br2)... The combination of plentiful moss with our dwindling supply of wildroot have proven sufficient to imbue the correctly-shaped monolith, and allow it to act as an anchor for the Fey. The slightly larger spirits magnetized to this provide enough energy for a specially-created imbuer.$(br2)This current process is rough and simple, and much refinement...

$(o)Notes from the Grovespeaker Allura Vysoren, 286 AC:$()$(br2)... curious side-effect of the monolith is the continued growing of plants & other greenery around it, slower than a direct magical approach but faster than natural growth. Whether this is a bleed-through from the Fey, the activities of the attracted spirits, or something more...
